Stock options are derivatives that give the holder the right to buy or sell an underlying asset at a specific price on or before a certain date. The price at which the option can be exercised (also known as the strike price) is predetermined when the option is issued.

When investors buy a stock option, they're purchasing the right to purchase a particular stock at the strike price up until the expiration date. If the stock price rises above the strike price, the holder can exercise their option and buy the stock at the lower price and immediately sell it at the market price for a profit. Likewise, if the stock price drops below the strike price, the holder can exercise their option and sell the stock at the higher price.

prompt:
Human: Can you explain Bitcoin blockchain technology? 
 Assistant: 

Bitcoin blockchain is a decentralized, shared public ledger that allows all Bitcoin transactions to be verified and stored in a secure and permanent manner. The blockchain is essentially a digital record of all the Bitcoin transactions that have been validated and accepted by the network. This record is shared across many computers called nodes and is essentially a distributed database of all Bitcoin transactions. The blockchain also acts as a public accounting ledger, recording all the digital currency sent and received by any user of the network. The blockchain is continually growing as new blocks are added by miners and each block contains confirmation of the previous blocks in the chain. Transactions on the chain are permanent and immutable, meaning that once a transaction is recorded, it can't be changed or removed without the consensus of the network. The Bitcoin blockchain technology offers unprecedented security for digital transactions and is often hailed for its innovation in the financial sector.
